caption: My group and I went to Cure for dinner after a long day, so of course we were exhausted and dying for something to eat. Right away, we were greeted very rudely by the hostess. We all immediately felt unwelcome before we had even been seated. I ordered a simple grilled chicken and my group had ordered steak and fish. After taking a few bites, we had all agreed that it was just alright, but nothing that special. The food wasn't necessarily bad, but it was a little under seasoned. Overall, the dining experience wasn't terrible. The lighting was nice, slightly dim and aesthetic. I also liked the placement of the televisions throughout the restaurant. Unfortunately, staff seemed short-tempered and confused the entire time we were there. The vibe of this place was lovely and enjoyable overall, but the staff were not welcoming.  The main issue with this meal happened a few hours after we left. I felt sick almost an hour or two later and suffered terrible food poisoning that laster all night and into the morning. I wasn't able to sleep and barely pulled myself together for my flight back to Texas that morning. We all joke about this experience now but it was definitely an unpleasant one.

Visiting DC for a conference, went Cure Bar & Bistro to have a drink after meetings. Bartender Marco was extremely rude. The other bartender working overheard the exchange and addressed Marco about his rudeness. I overlooked it thinking Marco may be going through personal issues that are affecting his work attitude. Trying to put this unfortunate situation behind us, I reached out to Marco and told him “hey, we started out on a bad note, but I love you anyway”.  He was not receptive. I finished my drink and ordered a second and was told I was cut off by the manager, Rachel. When I explained to her the situation she still refused to serve me a drink. As I further explained the situation, she offered a “free” drink which turned out to be a small glass of something watered down. If you are in DC, beware of Marco and Rachel at Cure Bar & Bistro. It appears that the service staff can treat their customers terribly and management will support it.
Had dinner and two lunches there. I was very satisfied with the food. Seafood (Octopus and Scallop) for dinner, and 5 tapas for lunch. Wow... The first bite immediately caught my happy supprise.
Cure Salad with Grilled Chicken... excellent.

The restaurant is attractive, and the food was very good. The grilled/roasted  asparaus was a standout. It was perfectly cooked with just the right amount of coarse salt seasoning it. The wait staff was also attentive and friendly.
Tried the Short Rib. Excellent
Atmosphere, service, and food were good, suffers from being in the hotel.

I visited for dinner tonight, ordering their ribeye entree and an old fashioned cocktail. The cocktail was great (over priced but great). I ordered the ribeye as Medium. It was Well done. Biggest pet peeve ever.
Food is good, small portions
Loved the seating arrangement for a relaxing dinner.

I usually have dinner here when staying at the Grand Hyatt at least once. Always exceptional! Last week we already had dinner at the event, and stopped in for an Ice Tea and a glass of water just to relax and recover from working. The managers who are always gentlemen,  refused to take anything for it, even though we used a table for a short while. Not a big deal? When you combine years of excellent food, exceptional service, location and phenomenal hospitality it is! There is no doubt Cure will be a stop on my next DC trip. My thanks to the management for going the extra step!
Ford was good,  drinks were great!
Came for lunch. Food is pretty good. Good service as well.
FANtastic eatery in the DC Grand Hyatt Hotel
Enjoyed my dessert and my waitress was too sweet
It was closed. Before 7 pm..smh

Enjoyed the Pick 4 for lunch on a very quiet Friday noon lunch. Server could not provide a useful response as to the size of the small plates; Pick 3 would have been enough food. Chose 2 from the Field, Farm &Kettle: mushroom strudel topped with whipped goat cheese which turned out to be more of a savory pastry surrounding a few tablespoons of cooked mushrooms, and the asparagus salad which turned out to be 10+ spears dusted with tiny bits of gouda. From Land & Sea, chose the lobster roll which was a 5-inch perfectly cooked and overflowing gem, and the chef's creation which was a shrimp and edamame salad. Each small plate was in the 8 to 10 forkful range so lots of beautifully prepared and presented food. The mint ice tea tasted like a very minty lemonade, but only regular ice tea was available for free refills. A rather expensive meal but well worth it for the quality.
Chicken soup was very flavorful.
Food not good
Surprisingly unique lunch menu with great attention to ingredients & great plating. Service was excellent!
Service was excellent! My waitress was top notch and very attentive.  The food was pretty good...prepared well but really overpriced.
Great staff.  Lovely dishes!
excellent food and location
Standard hotel bar, expensive

Dinner menu was confusing. Sandwich entrees were mixed with appetizers under a section called "shares". Menu items besides that were extremely expensive. Should be given $$$. Service was subpar. I had to wait 10-15 min to get mustard for my burger and they ended up bringing Dijon. I wish I would've continued to explore the other delicious food options I experienced during the rest of my stay in DC.

Drinks good, happy hour selection not bad. Prices seemed comparable to any Hyatt in this general area. Whole time I was there, bartender kept saying "the system is down." This, unfortunately, is a way to make EVERYONE THERE MUCH MORE SUSCEPTIBLE to identity theft. Unsat. Figure it out, Hyatt! THEN reengage. Thank you.

I was at the hotel for a conference, otherwise I would have explored other options. I was pleasantly surprised with the Chicken Noodle soup. Yes I was fighting off a cold so it was just what I needed. The soup was to my liking. All veggies were crisp and firm. The noodles were firm but well cooked. The broth was just how I like it, with lots of fresh cracked pepper. I had a flat bread pizza which was fine. The two martinis were okay, but small for the cost and measured. Other bars in the area give you significantly more value for what this place charges. They had tons of staff working so I expect that service elsewhere was good. I was at the bar so cannot comment on table service. In summary, quite good but certainly at a cost. If you are stuck in this hotel you'll be well taken care of.

Had dinner there one night and room service a second night. The food is quite nice, but actually the staff were probably the most excellent part of the service. Authentically nice and welcoming (both at restaurant and the delivery staff). Salmon was great. Mac and cheese was ok. Ceasar salad comes with grilled chicken (not noted on menu- was really nicely spiced).
Bar staff was extremely rude, we left.
The fact it was opened on Christmas Day night is worth the 5 star rating. Food was good. Attentive wait staff and upscale setting. Part of the Grand Hyatt Hotel.
Good atmosphere, nice bartender, food good. Love location
A bit pricey but excellent draught beers and flawless service
Great service and great food! Highly recommend the chicken soup, salmon dinner and chocolate mousse dessert 💗

Ordered food as room service while staying at the Grand Hyatt. I never set foot in the place but I can tell you that the pizza I order was incredible. I can't find their menu online to cover every detail on ingredients but, it had portabella mushrooms, garlic, spinach, red onion and gouda.  The crust was amazing.  I enjoyed every crumb of it!
Good eats here.  Nice place for an informal meet with colleagues and friends. Food is farm to table so it is good and fairly fresh. Would recommend a visit.
Good drinks, helpful staff
Hotel Bar!!!! Far too much noise and not from the music... However, good coctails!!!!!

Great food!  Service was horrible!  We were a party of 7.  Waited almost 2 hours to get our food.  We asked for our bills THREE TIMES and each time they said right away.  After 45 minutes of this nonsense, I went into the kitchen to find the waiter.  Told manager we had waited almost 2 hours for our food, and now over 45 minutes to get our bills.  The waiter was at the back register and came up and pointed to the register and said he was doing our bills now and tried to argue he was getting our bills... after we had already asked for the bills THREE times and the first time was over 45 minutes ago!  I know they were busy, and I have waited tables before and know how hard it is, but this wait was beyond ridiculous!
Waiting 1 hour for appetizers & still haven't been served.  Do not eat here!  Not worth it!

Not worth it.  There are other restaurants which are much better in DC.  Stay away from kids menu which are like cardboard.  Kids refused to eat and ate our food instead.  We had to eat their food, aka cardboard.  Not cheap neither.  Disappointing!!!
Great service ......and food. I had the applewood half chicken meal. Deliciousness
Came in for lunch waited 35 minutes before receiving my meal. Customer service wasn't the greatest. The manager seem unfazed by my concern of the long wait time. Will Not Eat There Again.
Bartenders were excellent and engaging both Rosès on the list were delicious
Victoria was fantastic !
Cozy spot for a drink
Delicious food, lovely friendly helpful staff. I had a great time! Thanks for the hospitality
Alex is a star!

My girlfriend and I had the pork chop and Salmon. Pork chop was a bit dry but the chutney with it was amazing. Salmon was good. Drinks were also good. Pineapple dessert pizza was oddly satisfying. Angel cake with blueberries was okay. Dessert took an oddly long time to come out though. We were walk ins on a Saturday evening and were seated with 10 minutes. Would recommend.

Went there for lunch today.  The service and the food were both excellent.  I was seated right away and the wait staff was very attentive.  The lunch menu is a great selection of small plates.  I enjoyed the butternut squash soup, an asparagus salad, and a slider--all of which were excellently executed.  I highly recommend this restaurant for lunch.  I'll be back.
The food is good. Some menu items are interesting. We really like the cheese board. It is a bit pricey for what you get, so just know that going in.

The bartenders (Jaime, Sandy, Victoria) are terrific, and the menu has an interesting variety of entrees as well as snacks. Not your typical bar food at all, with items like a cheese board, scallops, oysters, and a nice chorizo/shrimp app that was delicious. Definitely more than expected; hotel restaurants and bars can be really stale, Cure certainly isn't.
The wait staff was barely interested. The food was not good. Even the bun for my son's hamburger was dry. Avoid this place, except for drinks.
Food and drink were both good.  Service was lacking.   Quite easily a more expensive place then was listed as.  For one person, about 23 dollars.    Good for small groups, but no more than 10 people.
Delicious mixed drinks - happy hour specials are fairly priced. Food was also good - nice ambiance.
Hair in food, forgot to bring a few dishes and drinks.  Slow service. Check included items that didn't show up, had to point it out to waitress.
Delicious!
Food, drinks, services were great!

Flattbread was hard, dry like stone. We ordered a vegetarian  tomato flattbread without figs, first time they brought it with figs and without tomato, when we gave it back, they broght it with both ingredients and plus it was totaly dry and hard.  Service totaly irresponsible and the food  not worth the price. Don't recomand.

The food was good, but not good enough for what they charge. The wine list is limited and it was too crowded to enjoy our meal. For some reason they essentially seated us in the lobby. Not a place we'll be going back to.
Way over priced food and drinks. The food was mediocre at best and they tried,to relocate us from our seating area. Not worth the time.
The service was good, but the shrimp & oyster dish was excellently prepared.
Good but not worth the price we paid:)
